metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12654 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
An issue was found in Linux kernel before 5.5.4.mwifiex_ret_wmm_get_status() in drivers/net/wireless/marvell/mwifiex/wmm.callows a remote AP to trigger a heap-based buffer overflow because of anincorrect memcpy, aka CID-3a9b153c5591.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12654` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-177.207
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-177.207
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-177.207
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-96.97~16.04.1
